page.title: 07Hunters Lodge -Thatching
page.content: We went to Hunters Lodge to see a thatcher at work. He has been thatching for eleven years. He uses water-reed from Austria which is long, strong and usually lasts for 15 years. It is water-resistant which makes it ideal for thatching, but it is easily cracked. He also uses wheat straw. This is expensive and lasts for 6 years but bends easily so he uses it for the ridge with wire-netting to keep the birds off. He uses a boning knife to trim the straw around the chimney. The reeding pin is stuck in to hold the reed in place while he puts in hazel spars which have been split and twisted to be stuck in the thatch to hold it there. A biddle is a tool which is stuck into the thatch and the thatcher stands on it. Alan has twelve which he uses as a roof ladder. Thatching is not an easy job.
